Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: michal o
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on October. Room was ok, very basic but no complaints. Close to Ku'damm and metro station. Service was good, we didn't encounter any problem. I don't know about breakfast because we ate outside the hotel, you can find some nice cheap breakfasts in the city. All in all everything went well, I just think next time in Berlin would prefer a hotel which is closer to Mitte neighborhood which is more central (although Berlin is known to have a few central areas) rather than Charlottenburg.

Reviews.Title: “(positive) surprise in the basement”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: When booking the booking engine (venere) did not tell me that the room I was booked was in the basement, so it was quite a surprise to find out from the reception at check-in about the location of the room. Anyway, I have asked to visit the room first and I found that a) newly done, great furniture, spotless and very modern bathroom b) indeed basement (window only a small strip close to ceiling As I was only staying for one night the room was perfect for me and no need to change. All was fine I slept great. Did not test the breakfast tough, but internet in the lobby is working great and is free.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anirudh48
Reviews.Content: I was there for a weekend and I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is located on the main market of Kudam which is full of activities. The proximity to the metro and the near by areas make it a good choice. The only problem was the breakfast as it was very simple spread. Rest its a good choice if you wanna crash in just for the nite.

Reviews.Title: “You get your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: gwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Clean small rooms with a moderately helpful staff. An inexpensive hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money, top location for business & pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Shreks
Reviews.Content: I spent already 35 days this year in Berlin, but unfortunately never in this hotel. This hotel is greatly located one street behind the famous Ku'dam avenue. Great service, friendly employees and clean rooms. Great value for the money, business wise and/or for pleasure. Restaurants, cafe's are within steps away. Worth every euro cent, and not many being asked for a night. I paid only €30 per night! Just great!

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP and there is a reason why”
Reviews.Author: hartlando
Reviews.Content: First room we were showed STUNK....asked for another and got end of hall on 4th floor at back the next night. Little noise, slept well. Place is old and run down with stained carpets everywhere. incredibly average bathrooms and tiny. no amenities. was told internet in hotel....in lobby only...staff barely spoke a word of english..included breakfast was highlight of hotel. Location all right but at 49 euros...you get what you pay for. no more no less

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: iikor
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Quentin Berlin at the end of December 2010, came to Berlin for New Year. The room was very cold (around 15 degrees celsius) and the heating in the bathroom did not work at all. So we had to check out the same day and book another hotel, as it was impossible to stay. Besides, the photos and the room itself differs a lot. The furniture is old and broken, the tv does not work etc. The worst thing that they do not give me the refund for the days of the stay. They tell to the booking company (Expedia) that everything was really great and I left for no reason. The impression is that the hotel lives its last days and the main reason is to steal money from the customers. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone. And i would recommend the hotel to stop stealing money from the customers and to be more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose but not great...”
Reviews.Author: MattTripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quentin as part of a stag party of 10 attending the Berlin Beer Festival. The hotel is in a nice area, within a minutes walk of a quiet little bar & within a few mins walk to Adenauerplatz metro stop. Additionally the room was bigger than i'd expect for a major city... The downside was the corridors leading to my room & the room itself where in need of some TLC. The beds where uncomfortable & the pillows where non-existent even for someone who had been drinking all day. I especially couldn’t fathom why a radiator was needed directly under the shower ?? So would i recommend this hotel to a friend. For a group of lads on stag do prob yes for its cheapness & location. If travelling with significant other or family... no chance.

Reviews.Title: “big, clean...”
Reviews.Author: Grace87
Reviews.Content: ....and confortable rooms, the staff is kind, available and polite.. a good choice of channels on the tv.. Spongebob is a star in Germany!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing noticeable or great”
Reviews.Author: TravellerThilak
Reviews.Content: Overviewed this hotel through a online hotel booking web site and the review found this hotel as a budget and a value for money. I wouldnt say so, as the hotel lacked maintenance and its interior quality was well below average. Some advantage of this hotel was surely its pricing, car parking and proximity to berlin city and has a good sourroundings with shops and restaurants. Easy accessible through metro (3 min walk) and a major bus station near by (15 min walk). Not good in terms of breakfast served, room quality and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Berlin Experience”
Reviews.Author: cookmv
Reviews.Content: Stayed there while attending ITB Berlin. The Heating system of the Hotel was broken and we did not have hot-water in our Room Showers even to have a shower. Finally had to Carry water ourselves from there Kitchen Downstairs to Have a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: Armathwaite
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located by Adenauerplatz on the Ku'damm, reasonably priced with a good sized room. But walking into the lobby, the hotel looked worn and weary. The rug between the lobby and elevator was stained and frayed. The rug in my room was also stained. The desk personnel had limited English, with the exception of a very helpful woman on the night shift one night. The photographs on their website had no relationship to reality.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: meconopsis
Reviews.Content: Was ok if you want to book a double room, get there to find a twin with no apology, and rudeness from receptionists. Did they put ir right? no. It was clean, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: donalg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Itself. Three of us stayed in three rooms march 2006. We got a great deal of 45 euro a night excl breakfast. Breakfast is available at 7.50 . B'fast was a choice of cereal/yogurt/meat/cheese/egg and orange/tea/coffee. The rooms themselves are very large and en suite. They come with a minibar and TV. There was 2 english TV stations available (CNN and BBC world). Coffee / coctails were available at reception. There was no AC but had a ceiling fan. There appeared to be parking at the back of the hotel. Better to check with the hotel. Only slight quibble the curtains are a liitle on the light permitting side so one might need to bring eye shades. Locations This hotel is situated on a quite enough atreet off the Ku'dam. The nearest u bhan stop is adenaur platz. (About a 200m walk). As far as I could make out any bus leaving the zoo gatern going up the Ku'dam would get you to Adenaur Platz. General Comments about Berlin Berlin is a very big city so buy your all in travel card and save your legs. Trasnport around Berlin is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul_A1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late January 2006. We found the hotel to be fairly good value for money. The location is alright. Its in the Charlottenbeg/ wilmersdorf region and about 1min walk to the bottom of the Ku'dDamm which is excellent for shopping. The hotel rooms are of good size and are well kept and clean, however they are a little dated and old. It is very close to all public transport including the underground, bus and taxi rank. Also a short trip away from the main tourist attractions like the Branderburg Gate, the parliament and the tiergarten. Many of the museums/nightclubs however, are in the east of the city which is about 15mins away on the bus/train. Id recommend this hotel for budget holidaymakers and those who dont mind walking or using public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jdian
Reviews.Content: To be honest we booked this hotel because it was one of the cheapest available but we were very happy with the result. The big plus is its position, just off the Ku Damm and 5 minutes walk from the underground station and the bus stop for the airport. It's not exactly the centre of the social universe but there's a couple of decent pubs nearby (we liked the quiet traditional one on the corner, turn left out of the hotel) and a useful supermarket a few minutes down the road. Using public transport it's quick and easy to get to most places, at least in the old West Berlin. Staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were quiet, clean and big enough. The only real negative was the breakfast which was awful - mainly (very) processed meat, also they kept running out of everything, including bread and coffee and it was virtually impossible to find a seat. I'd suggest skipping it and going elsewhere. Despite this I'd still give the Quentin an above-average rating, purely because it offers excellent value for money if you're on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a good location, only one minute walk away from the Kuerfuerstendamm - the best and only place to shop in Berlin ( so I was told by the locals ). We stayed in this hotel weekend of 17th June 2004. I had no problems with rooms, staff or food - although continental wouldn't be my first choice for breakfast. The rooms we’re not very big, basic but clean is the best way you could describe them, but for the location and rate you pay you can’t go too far wrong. Hope this is of help to anyone going to Berlin, remember though, it’s a VERY BIG CITY!!

HotelInfo.Name: Quentin Berlin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Xantener Strasse 4, 10707 Berlin, Germany
